intro: Matelea linearipetala, commonly known as the linear-petaled matelea, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and other ornamental plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and showy, funnel-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a waxy coating. Matelea linearipetala is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
